name: nerc_P02
description: Predefined phenomenon data for vocab.nerc.ac.uk P02 collection

values.name: Benthic primary production
values.description: Parameters associated with the quantification of primary production by plants living on (e.g. corals, seaweed and seagrass) or in (e.g. benthic diatoms) the seabed.  Primary production is defined as the fixation of carbon dioxide into either organic or inorganic carbon by living entities and so includes photosynthesis and calcification.

values.name: Concentration of other substances in biota
values.description: 'Other'  (than metals or organic contaminants) substance concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.  This is a 'bucket' grouping that may be reclassified as the dictionary developes.

values.name: Phytoplankton taxonomic volume in water bodies
values.description: Any parameterisation of cell volume of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Oxygen production and respiration in the water column
values.description: Parameters related to the rates of oxygen production and consumption

values.name: Atmospheric particulates
values.description: Parameters quantifying and categorising the particulate phases (solids and aerosols) of the atmosphere, excluding chemical composition

values.name: Administrative units
values.description: Parameters (including geometries, labels and categorizations) relating to areas where authorities have and-or excercise specific rights or obligations.

values.name: Bird behaviour
values.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of birds (Class Aves), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

values.name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in biota
values.description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in either whole organisms or their constituent parts that are not included in other categories

values.name: Acoustic noise in the water column
Sediment water content, porosity and surface area
values.description: Sediment porosity (water content by volume) and water content by weight parameters

values.name: Date and time
values.description: All date and time parameters

values.name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the bed
values.description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples. This parameter group has been implemented to separate predominantly freshwater taxa from predominantly marine taxa.

values.name: Secchi disk depth
values.description: Measurements of optical visibility in the water column

values.name: Zooplankton gut pigments
values.description: Parameters identifying or quantifying zooplankton gut pigments

values.name: Groundwater amount
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of groundwater in a given system such as aquifer water level and rate of flow of water through rock formations.

values.name: Speleothem age
values.description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of secondary mineral deposits in caves. This includes stalactites, stalagmites, flowstone, and crystal growths.

values.name: Raw fluorometer output
values.description: Output as logged from any type fluorometer.

values.name: Temperature of geological units
values.description: Parameters that describe the distribution of the degree of hotness within a body of rock or unlithified sediment.

values.name: Colloidal organic carbon concentration in the water column
values.description: Colloidal organic carbon per unit volume of the water column.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of biological detritus in the water column
values.description: Flux of biological detritus (material derived from the water column such as exuvia and faecal pellets) in the water column

values.name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment pore waters
values.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of sediment pore water

values.name: Rock porosity and permeability
values.description: Parmeters describing the space for fluids or gases within a geologic unit comprising lithified sediments, igneous rock or metamorphic rock.

values.name: Fish morphology, age and physiology
values.description: Parameters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).

values.name: Transport activity
values.description: Parameters quantifying the level of activity moving people or cargo from one place to another.

values.name: Organometallic and organometalloid species concentration parameters in sediments
values.description:
All organometallic and orgamometalloid compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) 
in all phases of sediments (including pore waters)

values.name: Man-made structures
values.description: Parameters relating to human built structures on the coast or offshore and their impact on the environment.

values.name: Fishery characterisation
values.description: Parameters describing the extent, intensity, timing and method of fisheries

values.name: Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in the water column
values.description: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in the water column

values.name: Other wave statistics
values.description: Statistical parameters derived from wave data expressing wave properties other than height, period and direction

values.name: Geological sample radioactivity
values.description: Any parameters quantifying ionising radiation emitted by cores or samples comprising rock, sediment (including surface sediment such as fluff)

values.name: Concentration of alkanes in the water column
values.description: Alkane concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column.  Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.

values.name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) abundance parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Other physical and chemical properties of suspended particulate material
values.description: Parameters that do not easily fit into any of the other SPM data categories.

values.name: Passive seismic refraction
values.description: Parameters quantifying the magnitude of naturally occurring low frequency earth movements such as used for earthquake seismology and natural noise studies.

values.name: Zoobenthos non taxonomy-related wet weight biomass per unit area of the bed
values.description: Any zoobenthos wet weight biomass per unit area of the seabed parameters that are not included in parameter group ZWTX.

values.name: Concentration of proteins in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of proteins in all phases of the water column

values.name: Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations

values.name: Sediment lipid concentrations
values.description: Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc..  Sediment is defined as material collected by a corer (including fluff).

values.name: Sediment resuspension
values.description: Parameters quantifying the critera for and extent of sediment resuspension

values.name: Urea concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: Urea concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

values.name: Other halocarbon dynamics in water bodies
values.description: Parameters relating to the rates of creation and consumption of volatile halocarbons (compounds comprising carbon atoms covalently bonded to fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine atoms) other than tracers (i.e. freons/chlorofluorocarbons) and contaminants in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of carbon, nitrogen or organic matter in the water column
values.description: Fluxes of particulate total, organic and inorganic carbon (including as CaCO3) and nitrogen (often measured as 'total' but assumed to be 'organic'). Organic matter is defined as matter lost on ignition.

values.name: Bacteria generic abundance in sediment
values.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any soil or sediment.

values.name: Seismic reflection
values.description: Parameters relating to the elucidation of geological structure by quantifying the proportion of waves from a high energy source reflected by sub-surface layers.

values.name: Trace metalloid concentrations in biota
values.description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in either whole organisms or their constituent parts. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)

values.name: Ocean colour and earth-leaving visible waveband spectral radiation
values.description: Parameters associated with the measurement of ocean colour, including visible waveband satellite spectral radiometer measurements, their calibration measurements (spectral water-leaving radiance and reflectance) and chart colour estimates.

values.name: Cetacean behaviour
values.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of cetaceans (Order Cetacea), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

values.name: Raw temperature and/or salinity instrument output
values.description: Direct output parameters from TS instruments such as thermosalinograph or CTD

values.name: Metal concentrations in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of metal elements per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

values.name: Variable fluorescence parameters
values.description: Parameters measured by variable fluorescence instruments such as pump and probe and fast repetition rate fluorometers

values.name: Concentration of silicon species in suspended particulate material
values.description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in SPM (material gathered by filtration or sediment trapping). Only includes parameters expressed per unit mass of SPM and not per unit volume of the water column

values.name: Zooplankton feeding
values.description: Parameters quantifying the ingestion of food by zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger but excluding fish) in terms of identified biota or chemical species and the effects of nutrition on life processes such as physiology and reproduction.

values.name: Biota lipid concentrations
values.description: Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc..  Biota includes any type of sample originating from a living organism.

values.name: Concentration of aliphatic hydrocarbons in sediment samples
values.description: Aliphatic hydrocarbon (alkane, alkene, alkyne, polycyclic aliphatics like hopane, terpenes etc.)  concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

values.name: Concentration of proteins in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of proteins per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

values.name: Unclassified pigment concentrations in sediment
values.description: Includes all pigments that cannot be explicitly classified as chlorophylls, phaeopigments or carotenoids (usually groups of pigments). Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment.

values.name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone
values.description: Any zoobenthos ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters that are not fish or terrestrial animals (insecta/oligochaeta)

values.name: Other meteorological measurements
values.description: Bucket group for parameters that cannot be classified elsewhere

values.name: New production in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrate or gaseous nitrogen by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water

values.name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the littoral zone
values.description: Any zoobenthos abundance per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters that are not fish or terrestrial animals (insecta/oligochaeta)

values.name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related wet weight biomass per unit area of the bed
values.description: Zoobenthos wet weight biomass per unit area parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.

values.name: Marine environment leisure usage
values.description: Parameters quantifying the extent and nature of recreational activities in coastal waters, estuaries and their margins such as beaches.

values.name: Engineering parameters
values.description: Technical parameters that provide information on how well an instrument or data acquisition system is working

values.name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) abundance per unit volume parameters not included in group ZATX.  Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.

values.name: Carbon concentrations in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

values.name: Field resistivity,  electromagnetics  and polarisation
values.description: Parameters quantifying the electrical properties of geological units in the field. Includes parameters used to determine resistivity structure for shallow sediment properties, porosities and presence of hydrocarbon (CSEM), deeper crust and mantle studies (Magnetotellurics) and ore body location (polarisation).

values.name: Zooplankton growth rates
values.description: Parameters pertaining to zooplankton growth rates including biochemical proxies such as AARS activity

values.name: Unspecified
values.description: The identity of the parameter is not declared.  Covers cases such as internal working parameters and dummy channels.

values.name: Phosphorus concentrations in suspended particulate material
values.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic phosphorus per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.

values.name: Zooplankton and zoobenthos morphological parameters
values.description: Morphological parameters of zooplankton and zoobenthos (essentially any animal except for insects, earthworms or fish), such as size, shape and weight.  Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).

values.name: Pharmaceutical concentrations in biota
values.description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.

values.name: Beach litter abundance
values.description: Parameters describing the abundance and nature of debris released on coastlines.

values.name: Bathymetry and Elevation
values.description: Depth of the water column or elevation of land surface relative to sea surface, geoid or other datum

values.name: Silicate concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: Silicate concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

values.name: Salinity of the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the concentration of sodium chloride in any body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere

values.name: Total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) concentration in the water column
Radioactivity in the atmosphere
values.description: All parameters associated with radioactivity in the atmosphere, including radiation counts, isotope activities and activity ratios.

values.name: Metadata parameters
values.description: Data parameters that carry information relating to a measured parameter such as measurement temperatures, integration depths, quantities sampled and incubation durations

values.name: Sedimentation flux of identified biota expressed as carbon in the water column
values.description: Fluxes of any biota or remains thereof (excluding faecal pellets which are classed as SPM) downwards through the water column

values.name: Sediment acoustics
values.description: Parameters relating to the elucidation of sediment structure by quantifying the proportion of waves from a low energy source reflected by sub-surface layers.

values.name: Suspended particulate material setting velocity parameters
Zooplankton reproduction rate parameters
values.description: All parameters related to zooplankton reproduction rates

values.name: Phaeopigment concentrations in sediment
values.description: Includes all variants of phaeopigment (chlorophyll degradation products). Sediment is defined as any solids collected by a corer, including fluff..

values.name: Micro-litter in water bodies
values.description: Parameters describing the abundance and nature of microscopic particles of man-made materials and in particular microplastics present in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Sediment accumulation rate
values.description: Parameters quantifying the volume, mass or thickness of particulate material that gathers on the seabed per unit time.

values.name: Water column photography
values.description: Digital images of the water column obtained using either still or video cameras

values.name: Biodiversity indices
values.description: Parameters describing the variety of entity types encountered in a population of living organisms

values.name: Microzooplankton generic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of microzooplankton (free swimming heterotrophic organisms smaller than 200um) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any fresh or salt water body.

values.name: Fish behaviour
values.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

values.name: Mineralogical composition
values.description: Parameters describing or quantifying the mineralogical composition of rocks and unlithified sediments.

values.name: Chlorofluorocarbon concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of chlorofluorocarbons (also known as freons or CFCs) in sny body of water

values.name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Bacterial consumption in the water column
Sedimentation flux of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the rate of alkenones (unsaturated aliphatic ketones) and alkenoates (carboxylic acid esters) sinking as particles through any body of water.

values.name: Wind strength and direction
values.description: Parameters quantifying the extent or direction of atmospheric movement. Obvious examples are wind velocity, windspeed and wind direction, but can also include derived parameters such as force, energy, power and power density.

values.name: Phytoplankton taxonomic biomass in water bodies
values.description: Any parameterisation of biomass (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen etc.) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities identified by their taxonomic names (e.g. family, genus, species) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Inorganic chemical composition of sediment or rocks
values.description: Parameters specifying the proportions of inorganic components (major/minor/trace elements, trace metals etc.) in sediment or rock samples.  Major elements includes the H2O+ and H2O- parameters reported by convention in oxide weight per cent geochemical major element analyses.

values.name: Terrestrial mapping
values.description: Parameters relating to the mapping of terrestrial features, including coastlines

values.name: Invasive species monitoring parameters
values.description: Parameters used to characterize and monitor biological invasion by non-native organisms.

values.name: Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in sediment
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of alkenones (unsaturated aliphatic ketones) and alkenoates (carboxylic acid esters) in any unconsolidated sediment including fluff.

values.name: Metal concentrations in the cryosphere
values.description: Concentration parameters for metallic elements in ice and snow

values.name: Bird counts
values.description: Parameters quantifying the number of birds (Class Aves) in a survey but not expressed per unit area. Includes presence/absence indicators.

values.name: Atmospheric humidity
values.description: Parameters that either quantify the water content of moist air or are specifically used in its determination (eg wet bulb air temperature)

values.name: Light absorption in the water column
values.description: Water column spectral absorption parameters

values.name: Suspended particulate material aggregates
values.description: Parameters relating to the abundance, size and morphology of particle aggregates in the SPM

values.name: Geological sample magnetic, electrical and acoustic properties
values.description: Any parameters quantifying the magnetic (e.g. magnetic susceptibility), electrical (e.g. resistivity) or acoustic (e.g. P-wave propogation speed) of sediment or rock cores and samples

values.name: Fish reproduction
values.description: Parameters that quantify the fecundity, reproductive rates or nature of reproduction in fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).

values.name: Stable isotopes in biota
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) from measurements on living (at the time of sampling) organisms or parts thereof.

values.name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the atmosphere
values.description: Parameters quantifying polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

values.name: Wave height and period statistics
values.description: Statistical parameters derived from wave records to express wave height and period.

values.name: Cetacean abundance
values.description: Parameters that specify the number of specified members of Order Cetacea present at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.

values.name: Fish non taxonomy-related morphology
values.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) size and shape parameters not included under FATM.  Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.

values.name: Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in sediment
values.description: Includes all variants of chlorophyll.  Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment

values.name: Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the atmosphere
values.description: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

values.name: Sediment grain size parameters
values.description: Parameters specifying the physical dimensions of the particles comprising unlithified sediment (including expressions of shape such as aspect ratio) and statistics derived from their variation in a sample (e.g. mean, mode, sorting, skewness).

values.name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the water column
values.description: PCB concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group excludes SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight).

values.name: Uptake of other nutrients in the water column
values.description: Uptake of nutrients other than nitrogen species (ie phosphate and silicate) by the water column

values.name: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the atmosphere
values.description: Includes visible waveband measurements at discrete wavelengths and PAR integrated values as photon and energy fluxes. Does not include satellite radiometer and associated calibration parameters (e.g. water-leaving radiance and reflectance)

values.name: Excretion rate parameters in the water column
values.description: Includes all parameters relating to all mechanisms of waste release except respiration.

values.name: Radiation geophysics
values.description: Parameters quantifying the level of radioactive emissions from in-situ geologic units

values.name: Dissolved total or organic phosphorus concentration in the water column
values.description: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved phosphorus per unit volume of the water column. Grouped together as organic phosphorus frequently determined as total phosphorus.

values.name: Fish taxonomy-related counts
values.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

values.name: Seal abundance
values.description:
Parameters related to the distribution of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae)
at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.

values.name: Density of the water column
values.description: Absolute determinations of water column density plus parameters (generally expressed as density anomaly) derived from temperature and salinity

values.name: Nutrient concentrations in sediment pore waters
values.description: Nutrient (nitrate, nitrite, ammonium, phosphate, silicate and urea) concentrations in sediment pore waters

values.name: Nitrate+nitrite concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: Deprecated term from a misguided attempt to distinguish between NO3 and NO3+NO2 for discovery. Use parameter group NTRA instead

values.name: Sedimentation flux of pigments in the water column
Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in sediment pore waters
values.description: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in sediment pore water samples

values.name: Concentration of silicon species in sediment
values.description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)

values.name: Zooplankton and zoobenthos development stage parameters
values.description: Development stage parameters (such as proportion but excluding abundance or biomass) of zooplankton and zoobenthos. Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).

values.name: Molecular biology parameters
values.description: Any parameters relating to molecular biology or genetics

values.name: Sediment age
values.description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of marine sediments

values.name: Zoobenthos taxonomic abundance
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of animals living on or near the seabed designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus).

values.name: Trace metalloid concentrations in sediment pore water
values.description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in water occupying the space between sediment grains. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)

values.name: Palaeoclimatic indicators and parameters
values.description: Parameterisations that describe climatic conditions in the past.  Includes climate indices, climate indicators and indirect measurements of climate-related phenomena such as sea level and water table depth.

values.name: Dissolved inorganic nitrogen concentration in the water column
values.description: Total concentration of all dissolved inorganic nitrogen species in the water column, usually derived by summation of individual nutrient concentrations (NO3+NO2+NH4). Some workers may also include urea.

values.name: Habitat extent
values.description: Parameters specifying the vertical and horizontal spatial extent of the ecological character of a place where an organism is found

values.name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in the atmosphere
values.description: Parameters quantifying concentrations of organic contaminants (substances regarded as harmful) other than PCBs and PAHs in all phases of the atmosphere

values.name: Industrial activity
values.description: Parameters that quantify the level of industrial activity or industrial output

values.name: Rock grain size
values.description: Parameters specifying the physical dimensions of the particles comprising lithified sedimentary rocks (including expressions of shape such as aspect ratio) and statistics derived from their variation in a sample (e.g. mean, mode, sorting, skewness).

values.name: Concentration of alkanamines (amines) in the water column
values.description: Alkanamine concentrations in all phases of the water column

values.name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in sediment samples
values.description: PAH concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

values.name: Pharmaceutical concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in either solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water.

values.name: Stomach and gut contents
values.description: Parameters that characterize or quantify the contents of the stomach and gut of an animal or group of animals.

values.name: Coastal geomorphology
values.description: All parameters associated with coastal landforms such as beaches and dunes including morphology, evolution and associated transport phenomena

values.name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in the atmosphere
values.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of the atmosphere.

values.name: Nitrite concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: Nitrite concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

values.name: Lagrangian currents and transport rates in the water column
values.description: Parameters expressing the mean nett transport rates within the water column like Lagrangian currents. Note this is an unintentional duplicate of VDFC.

values.name: Electrical conductivity of the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere

values.name: Reference numbers
values.description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

values.name: SeaDataNet biological format biotic parameters
values.description: Parameters that quantify any attribute of a biological entity specified elsewhere in the data model and therefore do not map to the existing biologically classified P02 categories. This concept is used as a temporary grouping of parameter codes created for the SeaDataNet biological standard format.

values.name: Other fluxes between the bed and the water column
values.description: Fluxes of species other than metals and nutrients between the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes or sediment demand

values.name: Concentration of alkanols (alcohols), phenols and ethers in sediment
values.description: Concentration of alkanols, phenols and ethers per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

values.name: Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers, aldehydes and ketones in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers,aldehydes and simple (non-alkenone) ketones in unlithified sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff).

values.name: Raw suspended particulate material concentration sensor output
values.description: Raw parameters (voltages and counts) from in-situ suspended particulate material sensors including transmissometers, nephelometers,in-situ particle sizers and ABS (including ADCP echo intensity).

values.name: Moored instrument depth
values.description: Parameters expressing depth (possibly as pressure) of an instrument on a suspended underwater mooring.  These are primarily collected to monitor mooring performance by quantifying knock-down and should not be regarded as instrument z co-ordinates (accurate calibration is rare) or as sea level measurements.

values.name: Cetacean reproduction
values.description: Parameters related to the reproduction of cetaceans (Order Cetacea)

values.name: Vertical velocity of the water column (currents)
values.description: Vertical water movement parameters including non-directional speeds

values.name: Air temperature
values.description: Parameters quantifying the degree of hotness of the atmosphere.  Specifically excludes indirect measurements of other parameters such as wet bulb temperatures.

values.name: Sound velocity and travel time in the water column
Phytoplankton generic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, abundance) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. microphytoplankton, ciliate, flagellate) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Vertical spatial coordinates
values.description: All vertical spatial parameters including depth, height and pressure when used as an independent variable.

values.name: Particulate total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of total and organic nitrogen in the particulate phase of the water column, which is a function of both the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of nitrogen per unit weight of SPM. Note that it is commonly assumed that all particulate nitrogen is organic.

values.name: Concentration of adenylates in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) in all phases of the water column

values.name: Pesticide concentrations in biota
values.description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.

values.name: Water quality bioindicators
values.description: Parameters quantifying fauna and flora that indicate physical or chemical conditions in the water column such as colonisation depths and abundance of indicator species.

values.name: Contaminant fluxes between the terrestrial and marine environment
values.description: Parameters quanitifying the transfer of substances considered harmful from land to sea, including river discharge rates of contaminant species (but not freshwater discharge rates).

values.name: Magnetics
values.description: Parameterisations of the intensity and inclination of Earth's magnetic field

values.name: Metal concentrations in suspended particulate material
values.description: Concentrations of metal elements in suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Deprecated as semantic overlap with MTWP.

values.name: Carotenoid pigment concentrations in sediment
values.description: Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment

values.name: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Microzooplankton carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards., but exclude morphological classifications such as 'heterotrophic flagellate'.

values.name: Zooplankton carbon biomass per unit area of the water column
values.description: Integrated zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) carbon biomass parameters

values.name: Dissolved oxygen parameters in the water column
values.description: All dissolved oxygen parameters (including saturation and utilisation) for the water column

values.name: Horizontal spatial co-ordinates
values.description: All forms of horizontal spatial coordinates such as lat/lon and grid references

values.name: Phaeopigment concentrations in the water column
values.description: Includes all variants of phaeopigment (chlorophyll degradation products) expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column.  Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.

values.name: Concentrations of carboxylic acids and carboxylates in the atmosphere
values.description: Parameters quantifying the concentration of acids containing a carboxyl (-C(=O)OH) group, their anions or their salts in any phase of the atmosphere

values.name: Horizontal velocity of the water column (currents)
values.description: Parameters expressing the velocity (including scalar speeds and directions) of water column horizontal movement, commonly termed Eulerian currents

values.name: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biosurface area per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Microzooplankton surface area per unit volume of the water column parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Transmittance and attenuance of the water column
values.description: Parameters relating to the rate of electromagnetic radiation intensity decrease as it travels through the water column

values.name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the littoral zone
values.description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) abundance per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters.

values.name: Concentration of organic matter in the atmosphere
values.description: Parameters quantifying uncategorised organic substance concentrations in atmospheric, generally aerosol, samples such as organic matter and DOC.

values.name: Metal fluxes between the bed and the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the exchange of metalsbetween the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes

values.name: Turbulence in the water column
values.description: Measured parameters expressing turbulence in the water column plus parameters derived from these measurements

values.name: Macroalgae generic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of macroalgae (seaweeds) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any fresh or salt water body.

values.name: Raw X-Ray fluorometer (XRF) output from sediment samples
Plankton biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Used for plankton carbon biomass parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible

values.name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in water bodies
values.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water

values.name: Inorganic phosphorus species concentrations in the atmosphere
values.description: Concentration of inorganic phosphorus species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere

values.name: Particulate total and organic carbon concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of total and organic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a filtration technique. This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column and is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of carbon per unit weight of SPM.  Total and organic carbon are classed together to circumvent confusion caused by total carbon data sets labelled 'POC' on the assumption that the inorganic carbon fraction is negligible

values.name: Vertical platform movement
values.description: Parameters quantifying the upward and downward motion of objects mounting sensors or collecting samples.

values.name: Zooplankton defecation rates in the water column
values.description: Faecal pellet production and gut evacuation rates

values.name: Bird taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of surface
values.description: Bird (Class Aves) abundance per unit area (of land or sea) presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Sampling parameters
values.description: Qualitative and quantitative parameters related to the sampling activity; includes terms related to sampling effort, sampling gears, sample processing.

values.name: Raw pH sensor output
values.description: Raw pH parameter output from any type of pH sensor.

values.name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in biota
values.description: PCB concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

values.name: Carbon concentrations in suspended particulate material
values.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.

values.name: Concentrations of biopolymers in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of naturally-produced organic (molecules containing carbon) compounds that are built from multiple instances of structural units (monomers) that are covalently-bonded to produce larger structures in any body of salt or fresh water. Includes polynucleotides (RNA and DNA), polypeptides and polysaccharides (e.g. cellulose).

values.name: Macroalgae and seagrass taxonomy-related counts
values.description: Macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota) and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) count parameters presented at the level of taxa at any level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of metallic and metalloid elements and isotopes in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying metal and metalloid fluxes as element concentration or isotope activities per unit area per unit time

values.name: Virus abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of viruses in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Seal behaviour
values.description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions, usually in response to the environment, of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).

values.name: Plankton abundance per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Used for plankton abundance parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible

values.name: Phosphorus concentrations in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic phosphorus per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

values.name: Temperature of the water column
values.description: Temperature parameters in any body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere excluding the top few microns sampled by radiometers known as the skin

values.name: Fauna abundance per unit area of the bed
values.description: Any fauna (class Animalia) abundance per unit are of sea, river or lake bed.  Broad group overlapping a number of more specific groups that should be used preferentially, but this group is provided as an alternative to one-to-many mappings.

values.name: Colloidal metal concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of metal elements in the colloidal phase of the water column. Usually the dissolved concentration difference between conventionally filtered water and ultra-filtered water.

values.name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in suspended particulate material
values.description: 'Other' organic contaminant (substances regarded as harmful other than PCBs and PAHs) concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

values.name: Sea level expressed as pressure
values.description: Measurements of the displacement of the water column surface from a fixed, stable reference expressed as either total pressure or sea pressure

values.name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the water column
values.description: PAH concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group includes concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase, but not concentrations per unit wieght of SPM.

values.name: Fish taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed
values.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.

values.name: Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Basically any bacteria carbon biomass parameters that aren't included in parameter group BATC because they cannot be mapped to specific taxa in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Bacteria are defined as Kingdom Monera, which includes cyanobacteria.

values.name: Metal ligand parameters in the water column
values.description: Parameters concerned with the complexation of metals as ligands in the water column

values.name: Fish disease and parasites
values.description: Parameters related to the infection of Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) by parasites and disease. Includes visual assesements and analytical data.

values.name: Sediment thermal conductivity
values.description: Parameters that describe the degree to which unlithified sediment is able to conduct heat

values.name: Dissolved total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved nitrogen per unit volume of the water column.  Grouped together as organic nitrogen frequently determined as total nitrogen.

values.name: Habitat characterisation
values.description: Parameters specifying the physical or chemical environment of a place where an organism is found.

values.name: Particulate trace metalloid and inorganic selenium concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements and inorganic selenium species in the particulate phase of any body of fresh or salt water collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry).

values.name: Metal concentrations in the atmosphere
values.description: Concentration of metal elements in any phase of the atmosphere

values.name: Ultra-violet (UV) radiation
values.description: Parameters relating to the intensity of ultra-violet radiation in either the atmosphere or the water column

values.name: Pesticide concentrations in sediment
values.description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'.

values.name: Concentration of organic sulphur species in ice
values.description: Concentration parameters for organic sulphur species in ice

values.name: Rock alteration
values.description: Parameters decribing aspects of a geologic unit that are the result of bulk chemical, mineralogical or physical changes related to change in the physical or chemical environment.  Includes weathering, supergene alteration, hydrothermal alteration and metasomatic effects not considered metamorphic.

values.name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in the water column
values.description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water that are not included in other specific categories

values.name: Nutrient fluxes between the bed and the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the exchange of nutrients between the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes

values.name: Structure and stability of the water column
values.description: Parameters describing or predicting water column structure plus parameters quantifying the dynamic stability of that structure

values.name: Partial pressure (pCO2) and fugacity (fCO2) of carbon dioxide in the water column
Total metal concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Concentration parameters for metal elements in the combined dissolved and particulate phases of any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Radioactivity in water bodies
values.description: All parameters associated with radioactivity in any body of fresh or salt water, including radiation counts, isotope activities and activity ratios. Activities per unit mass of SPM are included.

values.name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) carbon biomass per unit volume parameters not included in group ZCTC.  Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.

values.name: River flow and discharge
values.description: Parameters related to the volume of water passing through a point in a river system per unit time, including the rates of freshwater, dissolved material and particulate load discharge from a river into the sea.

values.name: Sea level
values.description: Measurements and predictions of the displacement of the water column surface from a fixed, stable reference

values.name: Atmospheric visibility and transparency
values.description: Parameters relating to atmospheric clarity, such as optical transmittance/attenuance, and resultant visibility

values.name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in the water column
values.description: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of the water column

values.name: Organometallic and organometalloid species concentration parameters in water bodies
values.description:
All organometallic and organometalloid compound concentration parameters 
(including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Dissolved metal concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of metal elements in the dissolved phase of the water column.  This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metal in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used.

values.name: Organometallic species concentration parameters in biota
values.description: All measurements of the quantity or mass of any organometallic compound in any living organisms or their component parts

values.name: Surfactant concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of compounds that lower the surface tension of a liquid, the interfacial tension between two liquids, or that between a liquid and a solid in any body of salt or fresh water. The term surfactants includes detergents, wetting agents, emulsifiers, foaming agents and dispersants.

values.name: Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the water column
values.description: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column.  Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.

values.name: Bird reproduction
values.description: Parameters related to the reproduction of birds (Class Aves)

values.name: Zooplankton chemical composition
values.description: Chemical composition of zooplankton expressed in terms of mass (or molar quantity) per specimen or per unit tissue mass

values.name: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biovolume per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Microzooplankton biovolume parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Raw oxygen sensor output
values.description: Raw parameters (usually membrane current and temperature) from dissolved oxygen sensors

values.name: Cetacean mortality
values.description: Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality in cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

values.name: Land vegetation
values.description: Parameters relating to land (including marshes and the intertidal zone) vegetation

values.name: Optical backscatter
values.description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of electromagnetic radiation signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)

values.name: Fishing by-catch
values.description: Parameters quantifying the capture of non-target species during commercial and non-commercial fishing trips

values.name: Phosphate concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: Phosphate  concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column

values.name: Ice age
values.description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated age of ice

values.name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in sediment samples
values.description: PCB concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'

values.name: Quantity of material dumped
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of liquids (e.g. ship's ballast) or solids (e.g. dredge spoil) deposited into the water column as a result of man's activities

values.name: Sea-floor litter abundance
values.description: Parameters describing the abundance and nature of litter data collected on the seabed.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of non-metallic inorganic species in the water column
values.description: Quantity of any inorganic species such as silicon (opal) and phosphorus passing through unit area of the water column in unit time. Carbon and nitrogen are regarded as organic and explicitly excluded

values.name: Experiment state variables
values.description: Measurements made at a given time of any state variable in a sample that is the subject of an experiment that will change the composition over time, such as the water sample in an incubation experiment.

values.name: inapplicable
values.description: There is no appropriate value.

values.name: Flow cytometry parameters in water bodies
values.description: Parameters derived from flow cytometry data analysis of water samples using in situ or bench-top flow cytometers.

values.name: Ice motion and related parameters
values.description: Parameters specifying the speed and direction of sea or land ice and the stresses associated with this motion.

values.name: Marine archaeology
values.description: Parameters related to the study of human interaction with the sea through the investigation of associated physical remains, be they vessels, shore side facilities, port-related structures, cargoes, human remains or submerged landscapes

values.name: Zooplankton and zoobenthos physiological condition parameters
values.description: Parameters indicating the health of zooplankton and zoobenthos taxa, such as fecundity, egg condition, presence of parasites/diseases etc.

values.name: Terrestrial water content
values.description: Parameters relating to the water held by land masses such as soil and vegetation moisture content

values.name: Groundwater chemistry
values.description: Parameters quantifying the chemistry of terrestrial groundwater bodies such as aquifers and waters percolating through rock formations.

values.name: Metal concentrations in sediment pore waters
values.description: Concentrations of metal elements in sediment pore waters

values.name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment
values.description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)

values.name: Zoobenthos dry weight biomass
values.description: Any quantification of the dry mass of zoobenthos (animals living on, in or near the bed of any water body). Includes animals normally considered planktonic if collected in sediment and data expressed ash-free and in terms of carbon, nitrogen etc..

values.name: Microzooplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of microzooplankton (free swimming heterotrophic organisms smaller than 200um) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus or family) in any fresh or salt water body.

values.name: Light extinction and diffusion coefficients
values.description: Parameters relating to the extent of light penetration into the water column

values.name: Fish non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) abundance per unit volume parameters not included under FATX.  Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.

values.name: Depositional environment
values.description: Parameters characterising the environment in which sediments were deposited either by observation or interpretation of sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediments.

values.name: Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the water column
values.description: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the water column

values.name: Cetacean morphology and physiology
values.description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

values.name: Sulphur species concentrations in the atmosphere
values.description: Concentration of sulphur species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere. Includes sulphur dioxide.

values.name: Raw in-situ nutrient analyser output
values.description: Direct output parameters from spectophotometric or chemical in-situ nutrient analysers

values.name: Stable isotopes in ice and snow
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in frozen precipitation (snow, hail, ice and slush), its accumulations (e.g. glaciers), sea ice and frozen fresh water.

values.name: Reduction rates in bed sediments
values.description: Reduction rates of any species in sediment cores

values.name: Sedimentation flux of identified biota in the water column
values.description: Fluxes expressed as number per unit area per unit time of any biota or remains thereof (excluding faecal pellets which are classed as SPM) downwards through the water column

values.name: Dissolved organic carbon uptake and production in the water column
values.description: Any parameter relating to the rate of DOC concentration change in the water column

values.name: Zooplankton dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by drying to constant weight.

values.name: Stable isotopes in sediment pore waters
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in either the solute or solvent phase of sediment pore waters.

values.name: Concentration of organic matter in water bodies
values.description: Concentration (not 380nm light absorption) parameters for dissolved or total organic matter (includes humics, yellow matter, Gelbstoff) in any body of salt or fresh water.

values.name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) protein biomass per unit volume for entities that have been identified by taxonomic name

values.name: Carotenoid and flavenoid pigment concentrations in water bodies
Lithology
values.description: Parameters describing rocks on the basis of physical characteristics such as colour, structure, mineralogy and grain size

values.name: Water body redox potential
values.description: A measure of the tendency of any body of fresh or salt water to either gain or lose electrons when it is subject to change by introduction of a new species.

values.name: Particulate inorganic carbon concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of inorganic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a fitration technique.  This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column. Consequently, it is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of inorganic carbon per unit weight of the SPM.

values.name: Rock thermal conductivity
values.description: Parameters that describe the degree to which sedimentary, igneous or metamorphic rocks are able to conduct heat

values.name: Horizontal platform movement
values.description: All parameters relating to horizontal platform travel, including distance run

values.name: Temperature variation in the water column
values.description: Parameters expressing the variation of temperature in the water column either as a function of space or of time

values.name: Side-scan sonar
values.description: A technique for mapping the morphology of the seafloor using a sonar swath projected sideways from a towed underwater vehicle.

values.name: Fishing effort
values.description: Parameters that quantify or classify the physical or financial resources used in fishing activities

values.name: Phytoplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, abundance) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Sediment microfossil morphology parameters
values.description: Parameters relating to the size, shape and form of microfossils in sediment samples

values.name: Wind stress and shear
values.description: Parameters related to forces due to interactions between atmosphere and the surface of the earth or between atmospheric air masses

values.name: Atmospheric emissions
values.description: Parameters quantifying and describing the release of substances into the atmosphere as a result of human activity

values.name: Regenerated production in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrogen from excretion products (ammonium and urea) by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water

values.name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in biota
values.description: PAH concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

values.name: Land surface temperature
values.description: Parameters relating to land surface temperature including fire and other hot spot location

values.name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the atmosphere
values.description: Parameters quantifying polychlorobiphenyl (PCB) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

values.name: Microphytobenthos abundance
values.description: Any quantification of the number (e.g. count, abundance) of microalgae present on hard substrate or soft sediment at the bottom of any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Seal reproduction
values.description: Parameters related to the reproduction of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).

values.name: Ozone and oxygen concentrations in the atmosphere
values.description: Ozone and oxygen concentration parameters in any phase of the atmosphere (but usually the gaseous phase)

values.name: Primary production in the water column
values.description: Parameters associated with the quantification of primary production.  This is defined as the fixation of carbon dioxide into either organic or inorganic carbon by living entities and so includes photosynthesis and calcification.

values.name: Distribution coefficients in the water column
values.description: Distribution coefficients of species between the dissolved and particulate phases of the water column

values.name: Phytoplankton generic biomass in water bodies
values.description: Any parameterisation of biomass (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen etc.) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. microphytoplankton, ciliate, flagellate) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Stable isotopes in water bodies
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in both the dissolved and particulate phases of any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) protein biomass per unit volume for entities that have not been identified by taxonomic name

values.name: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column
values.description: Includes measurements at discrete wavelengths and PAR integrated values, measurements as photon and energy fluxes.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of amino acids and associated compounds in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group (including compounds such as salts and esters) sinking vertically as particles through a unit area of a water body in units time.

values.name: Gas fluxes between the water column and the atmosphere
values.description: Fluxes of any gaseous species from water column to atmosphere

values.name: Concentration of organic matter in sediments
values.description: Parameters quantifying the proportion of organic material in a soil or sediment sample

values.name: Industrial discharges
values.description: Parameters that quantify and specify material output into the environment as a result of industrial activity

values.name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in suspended particulate material
values.description: PAH concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

values.name: Amino acids in sediment
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in unlithified seabed material.

values.name: Snow and ice mass, thickness and extent
values.description: Measurements of quantity (mass), thickness and spatial extent of snow and ice

values.name: Unclassified pigment concentrations in the water column
values.description: Includes all pigments that cannot be explicitly classified as chlorophylls, phaeopigments or carotenoids.  Generally, these are parameters where different pigments have been grouped together. Concentrations are expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column.  Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.

values.name: Shellfish reproduction
values.description: Parameters that quantify the fecundity, reproductive rates or nature of reproduction in shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries).

values.name: Sedimentation flux quantification in the water column
values.description: Parameters expressing the total sedimentation flux in terms of particle mass, volume or counts

values.name: Phycobolin pigment concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentration of phycobolin group pigments such as phycocyanin and phycoerythrin in the water column

values.name: Particulate total and organic phosphorus concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of total and organic phosphorus in the particulate phase of the water column, which is a function of both the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of phosphorus per unit weight of SPM.

values.name: Organosulphur and organoselenium species concentration parameters in water bodies
values.description:
All organosulphur and organoselenium compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) 
in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of terrestrially derived material in the water column
values.description: Fluxes of terrestrial biological or lithological material

values.name: Nitrification rate in the water column
values.description: Parameters relating to the rate of nitrification (oxidation of reduced nitrogen such as ammonium) in the water column

values.name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in sediment samples
values.description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff' that are not included in other specific categories

values.name: Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in water bodies
values.description:
Includes all variants of chlorophyll expressed in terms of per unit volume, 
per unit area of any body of fresh or salt water, or as a relative colour index (e.g. PCI). 
Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.

values.name: Bacteria taxonomic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Radioactivity in biota
values.description: All parameters associated with radioactivity in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

values.name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in ice
values.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in ice

values.name: Fish taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the bed
values.description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.

values.name: Rock temperature
values.description: Parameters that describe the distribution of the degree of hotness within geologic units of lithified sedimentary, igneous of metamorphic rock.

values.name: Bioluminescence parameters
values.description: Parameters describing the nature and intensity of light generated by biological activity in the water column.

values.name: Nitrogen concentrations in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic nitrogen per unit weight of sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.

values.name: Pollution events
values.description: Parameters quantifying the accidental spillage of liquid or dry pollutants from vessels or marine industries. Parameters may include quantities of pollutant, areas affected and event duration.

values.name: Microphytobenthos biomass
values.description: Any quantification of the mass (e.g. carbon, nitrogen, weight) of microalgae present on hard substrate or soft sediment at the bottom of any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Carbonate chemistry in sediment pore waters
values.description: Carbonate system parameters (DIC/TCO2, pH, alkalinity, pCO2) in sediment pore waters

values.name: Two-dimensional seismic reflection
values.description: Parameters relating to structure beneath sea-bed determined by the reflection of seismic energy along a single track.

values.name: Seismic refraction
values.description: Parameters relating to the elucidation of geological structure by quantifying the refration of waves from a high energy source by sub-surface layers.

values.name: Concentration of phycotoxins in biota
values.description: Parameters associated with the concentration of algae-generated toxins in either whole organisms or their constituent parts

values.name: Stable isotopes in speleothems
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in secondary mineral deposits in caves. This includes stalactites, stalagmites, flowstone, and crystal growths.

values.name: Concentration of adenylates in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)

values.name: Dissolved organic carbon concentrations in sediment pore waters
values.description: Concentrations of dissolved organic carbon in sediment pore waters

values.name: Particulate metal concentrations in the water column
values.description: Concentration parameters for metallic elements in the particulate phase of the water column collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping

values.name: Insecta taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Insecta abundance parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Geological sample major element chemistry
values.description: Concentrations of the elements classically regarded as major (>1% by weight as oxide: namely: Si, Ti, Al, Fe3+, Fe2+, Mg, Mn, Ca, Na, and K) plus affiliated parameters such as H2O- (adsorbed water) and H2O+ (or loss on ignition) in rocks or sediments.

values.name: Macroalgae and seagrass infection and damage
values.description: Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota)  and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) and damage to seagrass beds

values.name: Dissolved trace metalloid and inorganic selenium concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements and non-organic selenium species in the dissolved phase of any body of fresh or salt water. This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metalloid in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te, and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry).

values.name: Dissolved amino acid concentrations in the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group dissolved in a body of water.

values.name: Carbon monoxide and dioxide concentrations in the atmosphere
values.description: CO and CO2 concentration parameters in any phase of the atmosphere (but usuall the gaseous phase). Includes pCO2.

values.name: Shellfish morphology, age and physiology
values.description: Parameters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries).

values.name: Shellfish abundance and biomass in water bodies
