values.description: Parameters that quantify the numbers or amount of living material of shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Bacteria generic abundance in water bodies
values.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Geological sample density
values.description: Parameters that describe the the mass per unit volume of any samples of rock or unlithified sediment.

values.name: Raw current meter output parameters
values.description: Parameters as logged by measuring devices, including raw counts/voltages and ADCP relative velocities

values.name: Stable isotopes in the atmosphere
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in both the gaseous and aerosol phases of the atmosphere.

values.name: Dissolved oxygen parameters for sediments
values.description: All parameters (including concentration, saturation, turnover and fluxes) for dissolved oxygen in sediment and sediment pore waters.

values.name: Metal concentrations in biota
values.description: Metal concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.

values.name: Fish biomass in water bodies
values.description: Parameters quantifying the mass of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes)in total or by species per unit area or per unit volume in any body of fresh or salt water expressed in any form (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen, etc.).

values.name: Reptile reproduction
values.description: Parameters related to the reproduction of reptiles (Class Reptilia)

values.name: Bacteria morphology and physiology
values.description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity of bacteria, defined as Kingdom Monera (includes cyanobacteria).  Includes parameters both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.

values.name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as nitrogen per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) nitrogen biomass per unit volume parameters not included in group ZCTC.  Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.

values.name: Pharmaceutical concentrations in sediments
values.description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'.

values.name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as nitrogen per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) nitrogen biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Concentrations of biopolymers in sediment
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of naturally-produced organic (molecules containing carbon) compounds that are built from multiple instances of structural units (monomers) that are covalently-bonded to produce larger structures in any sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff). Includes polynucleotides (RNA and DNA), polypeptides and polysaccharides (e.g. cellulose).

values.name: Concentration of alkanes in the atmosphere
values.description: Alkane concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere

values.name: Nitrate concentration parameters in the water column
values.description: Nitrate concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column. Includes nitrate+nitrite, which is often loosely referred to as nitrate.

values.name: Fish and shellfish catch statistics
values.description: Parameters quantifying and describing biota take by fishing activities

values.name: Platform or instrument orientation
values.description: Parameters that describe the displacement of platforms or instruments in space relative to various origins

values.name: Snow and ice physical properties and characteristics
values.description: Parameters related to physical properties (e.g. colour, density, in-situ temperature) or characteristics (e.g. sea ice type) of any kind of water sample that was in its solid state at the time of sampling or measurement

values.name: Inorganic peroxides in water bodies
values.description: Parameters related to compounds containing two oxygen atoms joined by a single bond but no carbon atoms in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Seabed photography
values.description: Digital images of the seabed obtained using either still or video cameras

values.name: Inorganic silicon species concentrations in the atmosphere
values.description: Concentration of inorganic silicon species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere

values.name: Terrestrial detritus in the water column suspended particulate material
values.description: Parameters quantifying and categorising terrestrially-derived detritus (eg dust and pollen) in the water column

values.name: Ammonium and ammonia concentration parameters in water bodies
values.description:
Ammonium and ammonia concentration parameters 
(including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Water body lipid concentrations
values.description: Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc..  Water body includes any body of fresh or salt water. As lipids are insoluble in water the concencentrations are associated with the particulate phase.

values.name: Metal uptake rates in the water column
values.description: Parameters relating to the uptake rates of metals from the dissolved phase into the particulate phase

values.name: Bacteria taxonomic abundance in sediment
values.description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any soil or sediment.

values.name: Raw gas analyser output
values.description: Raw concentration parameters from a gas analyser such as a LiCor

values.name: Bacteria in biota
values.description: Parameters relating to the abundance and nature of bacteria (Kingdom Monera) infecting other biota.

values.name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material
values.description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material (anything collected by filtration or sediment trapping).  Group does not include parameters expressing data per unit volume of the water column

values.name: Bacterial production in the water column
values.description: Parameters related to bacterial production determination by measurement of dissolved organic molecule (e.g. leucine, thymidine) uptake rates

values.name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment
values.description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or simple inorganic compounds (eg iodate) in sediments (anything collected by a corer including fluff

values.name: Reptile abundance
values.description: Parameters related to the abundance of reptiles (Class Reptilia)

values.name: Particulate amino acid concentrations in the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in solids suspended in a body of water.

values.name: Fish aggregating device usage statistics
values.description: Parameters describing usage of Fish Aggregating Devices (FAD) in fisheries (particularly purse seine tuna fisheries).

values.name: Concentration of nitrates in ice
values.description: Nitrate concentration parameters in ice. Includes nitrate+nitrite, which is often loosely referred to as nitrate.

values.name: Active seismic refraction
values.description: Parameters quantifying the magnitude of earth movements resulting from artificial sources (such as explosions) far away from the measurement site.

values.name: Phytoplankton taxonomic surface area in water bodies
values.description: Any parameterisation of cell surface area of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Cloud cover height and extent
values.description: Parameters describing the horizontal and vertical extent of cloud cover

values.name: Snow and ice chemistry
values.description: Parameters related to the chemical composition of any kind of water sample that was frozen solid at the time of sampling or measurement

values.name: Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column
Solar Radiation
values.description: Parameters quantifying the irradiance of the sun impinging on the Earth's surface in the visible and infra-red waveband, generally accepted as wavelengths between 300 and 3000 nm

values.name: Three-dimensional seismic reflection
values.description: Parameters relating to structure beneath sea-bed determined by the reflection of seismic energy along multiple parallel tracks.

values.name: Zooplankton wet weight biomass
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by weighing unprocessed catch samples.

values.name: Sedimentation flux of carbohydates in the water column
Bioassay and contaminant biological impact
values.description: Parameters describing the effects of substances on living organisms.

values.name: Trace metalloid concentrations in sediment
values.description: Concentration parameters for metalloid elements in sediment.  Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface. Metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)

values.name: Biological detritus in the water column suspended particulate material
values.description: Parameters quantifying and categorising biological detritus (eg exuvia and faecal pellets) in the water column that have been derived from the water column

values.name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone
values.description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters.

values.name: Litter abundance and type
values.description: Parameters describing the abundance and nature of material classed as refuse introduced to the environment by activities of man that are not covered by the more specific P02 terms for micro-litter (UMLS and UMLW), beach litter (BLIT) or seafloor litter (SLIT).

values.name: Zoobenthos generic abundance
values.description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of animals living on or near the seabed designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total).

values.name: Air pressure
values.description: Measurements of air pressure as the dependent variable (ie excluding air pressure measured to specify the z co-ordinate of a balloon or sonde), including derived parameters such as tendency (rate of change) and related parameters such as air density.

values.name: Microzooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Basically, any microzooplankton carbon biomass measurement that isn't included in parameter group MATC.  May include data integrations such as 'total microzooplankton'.

values.name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related counts
values.description: Zoobenthos count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.

values.name: Heat fluxes between the water column and the atmosphere
values.description: Parameters quantifying heat exchange between any body of water and the atmosphere

values.name: Organic sulphur compound dynamics in the water column
values.description: Parameters relating to the rates of creation and consumption of organic sulphur compounds (such as DMS and carbonyl sulphide) in the water column

values.name: Security tags and keys
values.description: Parameters used to encode information specifying access rights to data, usually in terms of authorised roles

values.name: Reptile disease and parasites
values.description: Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of reptiles (Class Reptilia)

values.name: Seal morphology and physiology
values.description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).

values.name: Acoustic backscatter in the water column
values.description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of acoustic signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)

values.name: Suspended particulate material grain size parameters
values.description: Includes all SPM grain size measurements and derived statistics

values.name: Zooplankton ash-free dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by gravimetric measurement of loss on ignition

values.name: Wave height estimates
values.description: Measurements of wave height that are not based on the statistical analysis of wave records, such as heave, surface roughness and visual height estimates

values.name: Geotechnics
values.description: Parameters quantifying the properties of rocks and sediments that are relevance to engineering such as physical strength and load-bearing capacity.  Includes the disciplines of rock mechanics and soil mechanics.

values.name: Gravity
values.description: Parameters relating to the measurement of the Earth's gravity field

values.name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in suspended particulate material
values.description: PCB concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc.  This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.

values.name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed
values.description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples. This parameter group has been implemented to separate predominantly freshwater taxa from predominantly marine taxa.

values.name: Radar backscatter
values.description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of emitted microwave radiation return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)

values.name: Precipitation and evaporation
values.description: Parameters relating to all kinds of precipitation (rain, snow, etc.) and water loss from the surface of the Earth

values.name: Bacteria taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment
values.description: Bacteria ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  The taxa may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.  Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.

values.name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment pore water
values.description: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of sediment pore waters

values.name: Concentration of silicon species in the water column
values.description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in all phases of the water column

values.name: Concentration of nitrogen species in the atmosphere
values.description: Concentrations of both organic (eg amines) and inorganic (eg ammonia and oxides of nitrogen) nitrogen species in all phases of the atmosphere

values.name: Water body released tracers
values.description: Parameters describing the amount in a sample of a tracer (rhodamine, SF6, 3He, etc.) that has been purposely released into  a water body to track water mass movements or quantify exchanges with the atmosphere.

values.name: Mineral chemistry
values.description: Chemical analyses of minerals extracted from rocks or sediment or analysed in-situ using techniques like the electron microprobe.

values.name: Micro-litter in sediments
values.description: Parameters describing the abundance and nature of microscopic particles of man-made materials and in particular microplastics present in the sediment.

values.name: Stable isotopes in sediment
values.description: Stable isotope parameters (concentrations, ratios and enrichments) in sediment, including biota-associated parameters such as isotope enrichment in foraminifera tests.

values.name: Geothermal heat flow
values.description: Parameters quantifying the  flux of thermal energy within the solid Earth or between the solid Earth and water bodies or atmosphere.

values.name: Insecta taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Insecta carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.

values.name: Dissolved organic carbon concentration in the water column
values.description: DOC per unit volume of the water column.  Note that this includes some parameters that are strictly defined as total carbon, because the water was unfiltered on the assumption that POC was negligible.

values.name: Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column
values.description: Concentrations of alkenones (unsaturated aliphatic ketones) and alkenoates (carboxylic acid esters) in all phases of the water column.

values.name: Hazards to navigation
values.description: Parameters describing the location, nature and extent of objects that pose a threat to travel on the water column such as wrecks and obstructions

values.name: Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the atmosphere
values.description: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the atmosphere.

values.name: Wave direction
values.description: Direct measurements (including visual estimates) plus statistically derived parameters

values.name: Rock age
values.description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of lithified sediments, igneous rock or metamorphic rock.

values.name: Sedimentary structure
values.description: Parameters characterising structure in sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediment such as bedding, lamination and bioturbation.

values.name: Nitrogen concentrations in suspended particulate material
values.description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic nitrogen per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.  Note that it is common practice to assume all nitrogen in SPM is organic.

values.name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in ice
values.description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in ice

values.name: Pesticide concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in either solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water.

values.name: Seal mortality
values.description: Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality of true seals (Phocidae), eared seals (Otariidae) and walruses (Odobenidae).

values.name: Dissolved inorganic carbon production and respiration in the water column
values.description: Parameters related to the rates of TCO2 production and consumption based on light/dark bottle incubations

values.name: Precipitation chemistry
values.description: Concentration of any chemical species in water collected from the atmosphere.  Includes rain, snow, hail and fog but excludes cloud samples or snow accumulations on the ground.

values.name: Bacteria taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
values.description: Bacteria carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in a standard taxonomy registry such as WoRMS or ITIS.  These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.  Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.

values.name: Atmospheric deposition rates
values.description: Fluxes of chemical species from the atmosphere to sea or land surface including precipitation and aerosol deposition but excluding fluxes due to exchange of gases

values.name: Other halocarbon concentrations in water bodies
values.description: Concentrations of volatile halocarbons (compounds comprising carbon atoms covalently bonded to fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine atoms) other than tracers (i.e. freons/chlorofluorocarbons) and contaminants in any body of fresh or salt water.

values.name: Concentration of suspended particulate material in the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying SPM concentration in the water column by weight, by volume or in terms of turbidity

values.name: Transport in the water column
values.description: Parameters describing the transport of material, heat or energy in the water column

values.name: Fish abundance in water bodies
values.description: Parameters that quantify the numbers of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) at a given location in any body of salt or fresh water.

values.name: Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in water bodies
values.description: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and simple (non-alkenone) ketones in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water

values.name: Cloud type
values.description: Parameters that classify cloud cover into types such as cumulus and cirrus.

values.name: Spectral wave data parameters
values.description: Parameters for directional and non-directional spectral wave data, excluding wave directions derived from spectral data.

values.name: Alkalinity, acidity and pH of the water column
values.description: Parameters quantifying the hydrogen ion concentration in water bodies

values.name: Microzooplankton grazing
values.description: Parameters that express the consumption of the phytoplankton population by the microzooplankton.  Generally the results of dilution experiments on water samples screened through a 200-micron mesh.

values.name: Skin temperature of the water column
values.description: Temperature of the water column surface as measured by a radiometer.  It does NOT include temperature measurements in the upper few metres of the water column such as thermosalinograph data
